Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hit a go-ahead grand slam in the third inning.
New York Yankees added six runs against the Dodgers' bullpen, marking the first time they won a game by more than three runs in this postseason.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge's eighth-inning RBI single was a good sign.
Volpe's tremendous all-around performance could portend the sort of lineup depth the Yankees need.
Austin Wells also went 2-for-3 and hit a home run.
